result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Reif McEiver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Credit of 5 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment.
Sign up for probation no later than 10/07/22 by 5:00pm.

miscConds.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample by 12/07/22 and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No contact with NMS and KWF.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Reif McEiver

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam Reif McEiver in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Adam Reif McEiver.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 5 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 12/07/22.
- Complete 30 hours of community service.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- No contact with NMS and KWF.
- Submit a DNA sample by 12/07/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Adam Reif McEiver in court.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Adam Reif McEiver.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.  Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire, Waiver of Rights

Defendant Adam Reif McEiver in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Lutgen has received discovery and needs an offer. Defense is requesting a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.W.F.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Adam Reif McEiver in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Adam Reif McEiver in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adam Reif McEiver appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
